questions.question_text: Records in the recycle bin do NOT count against your organization's storage limits

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
When you delete records, they are moved to the recycle bin, allowing for a recovery period before they are permanently deleted. However, during this period, the storage space occupied by these deleted records still contributes to your organization's overall storage usage.

questions.question_text: The page layout allows users to see the Next Steps field on an Opportunity record, Field Level Security dictates that the field is hidden, how will the field appear to the user?

choices.A: The field will be hidden from the user
choices.B: The field will be read only

choices.D: The field appears in deleted list from where it can be undeleted
choices.B: The field and its data are permanently deleted
choices.C: The data in the field is saved and the field is permanently deleted

questions.question_text: What happens when you delete a custom field?

discussion.content:
Part of this question is missing. 
A. To prevent users from entering bad data
B. To ensure users enter data only when it is required
C. To prevent bad data being imported
D. To hide fields from certain users

Ans should be
To prevent users from entering bad data
To ensure users enter data only when it is required
To prevent bad data being imported
